alert.note: Alert for Western Nevada Basin and Range including Pyramid Lake (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued August 19 at 1:53PM PDT by NWS Reno
info.description: .Hurricane Hilary is still expected to make landfall in the northern part of the Baja of California on Sunday. While the system will rapidly weaken, deep moisture will stream into the Desert Southwest. Gusty winds along with prolong periods of moderate to locally heavy rainfall will impact much of Nevada and eastern California. The system will quickly exit the area Monday evening, but showers and storm chances will linger through Tuesday. ...FLOOD WATCH NOW IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH LATE MONDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of east central California, including the following area, Mono County. Portions of Nevada, including the following areas, Mineral and Southern Lyon Counties and Western Nevada Basin and Range including Pyramid Lake. * WHEN...From Sunday afternoon through late Monday night. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Low-water crossings may be flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Hurricane Hilary will bring widespread impacts to much of the Southwest through early week. The biggest concern remains flooding from excessive rainfall. While periods of rainfall are possible at anytime over the next 4 days, Sunday afternoon through Monday will be the window where we will have the greatest flooding threat as the remnants of Hilary moves through central Nevada. - https://www.weather.gov/safety/flood https://www.Hurricanes.gov
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.

area.areaDesc: Western Nevada Basin and Range including Pyramid Lake
